alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 29 at 5:44AM EDT until September 29 at 7:30AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Melbourne has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Orange County in east central Florida... Northwestern Osceola County in east central Florida... West Central Seminole County in east central Florida... * Until 730 AM EDT. * At 544 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 6 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Apopka, Altamonte Springs, Ocoee, Winter Garden, Windermere, Bay Lake, Oak Ridge, Pine Hills, Celebration, Lockhart, Intercession City, Four Corners, Oakland, Bay Hill, Doctor Phillips, Universal Studios, Wet N Wild Water Park and Horizon West. This includes the following streams and drainages... Shingle Creek, Bonnet Creek, Wekiva River and Reedy Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
